H0.text: Photosynthesis is the ability that only about one percent of plants have lost, turning them into consumers and even predators instead of producers.

H1.text: Flowering is the ability that only about one percent of plants have lost, turning them into consumers and even predators instead of producers.

H2.text: Rooting is the ability that only about one percent of plants have lost, turning them into consumers and even predators instead of producers.

H3.text: Growth is the ability that only about one percent of plants have lost, causing them to become consumers and even predators instead of producers.

A4.text: Over 90% of plants use C3 carbon fixation, compared to 3% that use C4 carbon fixation; however, the evolution of C4 in over sixty plant lineages makes it a striking example of convergent evolution.

A5.text: The source of oxygen produced by photosynthesis

A6.text: First practical artificial leaf makes debut
